Zenah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a 3,000 litre-capacity water tank and bird sprayer. She believes that water security and a routine spraying of the poultry will ensure their survival.   That should improve her income, which will enable her to educate her children. She is also planning to purchase a motorcycle to transport her supply of eggs and milk to the market.

Zenah notes that there is lack of proper markets for her produce.  However, she is full of appreciation for Juhudi's loan services.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and poultry sprayer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Isatu B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in a place call Deep Eye Water, near Freetown, about 58 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. 

This is the first loan that Isatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

For over 22 years now, Isatu has been selling cigarettes, soft drinks, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc.  She will use her share of the loan (SLL 600,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soft drinks, gari, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a 34-year-old married father of four.  To support his family, he provides welding services.  He also sells second-hand clothes to earn extra income.  He has managed to improve his business since he joined Faulu Kenya, which led to an improvement in his standard of living.  He hopes to expand his business so as to increase his income.  With 40,000 Kes, he will buy a welding machine and a grinder.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and a grinder

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Henrietta K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Henrietta was born in Yonni Bana, a village in northern Sierra Leone, about 36 years ago. She is married to a medical doctor and they have three children.

For four years, Henrietta has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth). Henrietta will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy materials to make gara lappers to sell. 

This is the first loan that Henrietta and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce gara cloth for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes currently is in business selling in a retail shop. She is 40 years old and married to a businessman. They have seven children, only two of whom go to school. Agnes is requesting a loan to stock more retail goods to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Cellu... Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Cellu” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They are requesting a loan of SLL 4,100,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Hawa K.. Hawa is aged 37 years-old and was born in a place call Magbangba, in western Sierra Leone. Currently, Hawa is residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary school. 

Hawa sells market-food and has been doing this business for six years now. With her share of this loan, she W. buy rice, palm-oil, groundnuts, onions, pepper, margi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste) gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), and many more items in bulk in order to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, groundnuts, onions, pepper, margi cubes, gari, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Hendrcih

texts.en:
Hendrich A. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is a widow with six children all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).   

Hendrich has a business selling food from a stall.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hendrich sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail.    Hendrich has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more fresh cowpeas, beans and apples.    She also generates additional income through rental rooms.    

The main business challenges for Hendrich include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and open another stall.   Hendrich lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh peas, beans and apples

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beads and reeds for making baskets

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon P. O. is 28 years-old and married. His wife runs a salon and they have three children aged between seven years-old and one year-old whom they hope to givea  good education to the university level. 

His business is located at a market in Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbours lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. He owns a barber shop in which he gives haircut services to the local people. He has been in this business for six years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is a lack of proper equipment. However, he works hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy shaving machines to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to diversify into a transport business. He describes himself as self reliant.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Merikebu Group

texts.en:
Eshi N., who is in her early fifties, is single with three children. She has been selling ladies clothes door to door as well as selling wheat to local brew businesses for four years. She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Eshi's fouth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more fabrics and sacks of wheat for the local brew and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her business stock. Her dream is to one day build her own house and take her children to good schools.

Eshi will share this loan with her loan group "Merikebu", which has a total of 17 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Eshi is first on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes and wheat

loans.name: Parmois Ole

texts.en:
Parmois Ole is 33 years old, married to Nosokon, and together they have four children. He has been a farmer for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000. Having repaid his first loan in a timely fashion, Parmois is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to buy farm inputs. With the profits generated, he plans to pay his children's school fees.

An assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources, he dreams of being rich.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a married lady with four children.  She does farming so as to earn a living for her family.  She has been farming for fifteen years. She was previously operating a butchery and a green grocery.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to run her business and gained business skills.  She hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy a cow and sheep.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sheep

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois N. is 47 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. His wife is teacher. 

Francois supplies onion, beans, maize and rice. His business is well-organized and he is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day and has two years experience in his business. 

Francois has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to supply a larger quantity of onion,beans, maize, rice and so on. With any profit, he will reinvest in his business and save money for his future.

loans.use: To supply onion,beans, maize, rice and so on

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 27-year-old businessman.  He has been selling fish for six years.  He has employed two people to assist him in his business.  He has become focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  Being a married man with one child, he works hard to raise his child.  He hopes to venture into the transport business in five years.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy more fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more scholastic materials for her schools and also to improve her flower sales business

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 35 years old, married and has two children. He is able to support his family with the income he earns from selling groundnuts. He also runs a retail shop. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business, which has enabled him to improve his standard of living. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES. He will use the loan to buy two sacks of groundnuts.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of groundnuts

loans.name: Iman Group

texts.en:
Mary A., who is in her early thirties, is married and has six children. She has been selling rice for two years. She works from 6:00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to buy more rice. Her dream is to travel upcounty and buy more rice for her business.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group called "Iman," which has a total of 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mary is second from left in a brown dress.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 26 years old. He is married and has two children – a five-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. Zaza lives in the village of Mukhrani, Kartli Region, with his family and his parents. 

Zaza has a shop selling household goods. He buys the goods in Tbilisi (capital city) and sells them in his shop in the village. 

The received loan will be used to purchase inventory for the shop – goods which are demanded by his customers. According to Zaza’s estimation, this will positively influence Zaza’s income. The main part of the increased income will be reinvested in the business and a small part of it will be expended on the family for various purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for the shop.

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Zulfa S., who is in her early 30s, is single with two children. She has been running a small restaurant where she sells pancakes, cookies and chapati (flatbread). She has been in businesses for two years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zulfa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start the business of selling chapati, cookies and pancakes and has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "Kitumbo," which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Zulfa is second from right in the front row.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Rose has a food stall business. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days a week. Rose sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more, bunches of yellow bananas. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and Irish potatoes.

The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and  to open another stall. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to piped water but doesn't have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret is currently in a business of selling small items such as beans. She is 40 years old, married to a businessman and has 4 children (2 of whom go to school). Magret borrowed a loan to stock more small items such as beans for sale. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more small items such as beans for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 25-year-old member of Royal Success group in Faulu Kenya.  She runs a salon so as to earn her daily bread.  Additionally, she earns extra income from farming.  She is a married lady with three children who are in school.  She works hard in her business so as to help her husband in educating her children.  She hopes to expand her business in the future so as to serve more customers.  She has requested for 30,000 Kes to buy hair blow drier, mirror and to renovate her business premise.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer, mirror, iron sheet and to renovate her business premise

loans.name: Lilian Beatriz

texts.es:
La señorita Lilian de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 21 años y  está cursando el 2° año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Tecnológica de Comercializacion y Desarrollo.
Ella tiene 3 hermanos: una melliza de su misma edad, también universitaria, un hermano mayor que trabaja para la micro-industria familiar(Panadería) y otra hermana de 12 años.
Su madre ayuda también en la panadería, mientras Lilian se encarga del empaquetado de los productos, actividad que realiza durante la mañana ya que parte de la tarde se dedica a su estudio.
Su padre se encarga de la administración de la micro-industria familiar.
Lilian tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio negocio, le encanta colaborar con la pequeña empresa de sus padres ya que ahí va aprendiendo mucho y eso le ayuda a esforzarse más y sobresalir entre todos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de su matrícula, su primera cuota de la facultad y algunos materiales que necesita.
Lilian agradece ya que esto le ayudaría en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Miss Lilian of the city if Villarrica, is 21 years old, and is in her second year of Business Administration in the Technological University of Marketing and Development.

She has 3 siblings: a twin who is of her age and is also in the university, an older brother who works in the cottage industry (Bakery), and another sister who is 12.

Her mother also helps in the bakery while Lilian is in charge of packaging the products in the mornings since she studies in the afternoons.

Her father manages the cottage industry.

Lilian has many hopes of finishing her studies and starting her own business. She loves collaborating with her parent's small business since it is there that she has learned a great deal and that will help her strive more and succeed.

She is requesting the loan to pay for her registration, her first tuition payment, and some materials she will need.

Lilian is thankful since this will help with her education and also knows she can count on future loans references which will be important to fulfill her projects.

loans.use: To pay for her registration, her first tuition payment, and some materials she will need.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.ar: باسمة في عمر 53 سنة متزوجة ولها 5 اولاد تحب عائلتها وهي تعمل في التجميل قص وبيع العطورات والكريمات لها في عملها 17 سنة تحب عملها وتريد التطور والتحسن في العمل لها خبرة واسعة في هذا المجال وتسعى الى تطوير عملها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة للخياطة حتى تتمكن من اضافة مهنة جديدة لها لكي تزيد ن مدخولها تحب عملها فهي متطورة ومتجددة وتحب ان تزيد من مدخولها
texts.en: Bassima, 53, is married with five children. She has been working as a beautician and a seller of perfume and cream for women for 17 years. Bassima has a lot of hands-on experience and she always seeks to develop her business. Bassima wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a sewing machine as she wants to learn a new craft to increase her income. Bassima is ambitious and likes her work.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chaibora Group

texts.en:
Zuhura S., twenty eight, is single and has been running a salon business for two years. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to start the saloon business and has paid it back successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more salon equipment for her business. Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group "Chaibora", which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Zuhura is in the back of the picture in a blue dress with a black belt.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to start a new business

loans.name: Christian David

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian David T. tiene 21 años de edad, este año va a cursar el 3er. año de Ingeniería Agrónoma en la Universidad San Carlos de Curuguaty, trabaja en el Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, desempeña la función de Técnico de Campo, solicita el préstamo para solventar los gastos de la matrícula, cuotas y materiales para las clases prácticas que tiene la carrera, como visitas al campo, el mismo presenta la codeudoría de la madre, funcionaria del 3er. Cuerpo de Ejército de Caballería.
El joven solicita el crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que sueña con llegar a ser Ingeniero Agrónomo y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Christian David T. is 21 years old.  This year he will be in his third year of a degree in Agricultural Engineering at San Carlos de Curuguaty University.  He works in the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock as a field technician.

Christian is requesting this loan to pay his registration fees and tuition fees, and to buy materials for the practicals that form part of his degree course, such as field trips.  Christian's mother, who is an official in the army's 3rd Cavalry Division, will assume joint responsibility with her son for this loan.

Christian is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya because he dreams of becoming an agricultural engineer so that he can improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees and his tuition fees, and to buy study materials

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol R. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

R. raises chickens to sell, earning an income of US $1 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $40 on food and US $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

R. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. 

In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Joumana

texts.ar: جومانا في عمر 35 سنة متزوجة ولها ولد تعمل في بيع الألبسة الولادية لها في عملها 14 سنة تحب عملها وتجيده كثيرا تريدان تزيد من مدخولها وتحسن وضع عائلتها المادي والاجتماعي لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد كان له الاثر الجيد على وضعها العملي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شاء بضاعة موسمية ثياب وغيره
texts.en: Joumana is 35 years old and married with one child. She has 14 years experience selling children's wear. She loves her business and excels in what she does. She aspires to increase her income and thereby improve her family's social and financial situation. She has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua and past loans have produced excellent results for her business. With this loan she wants to purchase in-season clothing and other items to sell at her store.

loans.use: to purchase in-season clothing to sell at her store.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses M. L., 47, has been in the business of farming and selling sugar cane for the last four years in Kagera-Kakira-Jinja. Before that, Moses, who is happily married and has six children, was involved in a cattle keeping business. 

He started growing and selling sugar cane after a foreign investor established a sugar making factory around his village. Moses, like many of his fellow villagers, decided that was an opportunity they had to rise up to, given the ready market that was going to avail itself. 

Moses also has a modest milk sales business on the side. He says he is able to make profits to the tune of 1.5 million shillings monthly. 

With this loan, Moses says he is going to purchase more manure to improve his sugar cane gardens.

loans.use: to purchase manure to improve his sugar cane gardens

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Rukia S., who is in her early 30s, is married and has two daughters. She has been running a fruits and vegetables business since 2005. She works from 4:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase the fruits and vegetables she sells. Her dream is to one day open a dispensary because she is a qualified nurse.

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group, "Chamwino," which has a total of 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Rukia is second from right having a white scarf.

loans.use: to increase the stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gee

texts.en:
Gee N. is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. N. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 5 per day. One of her children is employed at a hotel in the town, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 37 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El Sr. Ivan R. C. tiene 19 años de edad, este año va a cursar el segundo año de Agronomía en la Universidad San Carlos de Curuguaty, trabaja en la Municipalidad de la misma ciudad, desempeña la función de Liquidador.
Solicita el préstamo para solventar los gastos de la matrícula, cuota y materiales para las clases prácticas que tiene la carrera, su codeudor es su mismo jefe, quien es contador de la Municipalidad.
El joven sueña con llegar a ser Ingeniero Agrónomo para así poder ayudar a su familia a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de él mismo.
texts.en:
Ivan R. C. is 19 years old.  He is about to start his second year of an agronomy degree at San Carlos de Curuguaty University.  He works for the City of Curuguaty as a liquidator.

Ivan is requesting this loan to cover his registration expenses and his tuition fees.  He will also buy materials for the practicals that form part of his course.  His boss, who is the City Accountant, will be co-signer on his loan.

Ivan dreams of becoming an agricultural engineer so that he can help his family to improve their quality of life and so that he can improve his own quality of life as well.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees and tuition fees, and to buy materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a businessman who runs a barber shop to earn a living.  He has been engaged in the business for ten years.  With the income from his business, he is able to provide for his wife and two children.  He hopes that someday, he will open other outlets for his business.  

He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access loans and also save his money. He has therefore requested 10,000 Kes to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas O. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. O. buys traditional baskets to resell, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 80 on other necessary expenses. 

O. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more baskets to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy traditional baskets to resell.

loans.name: Rajae

texts.ar: رجاء في عمر 37 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع الألبسة الولادية والبيجامات لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عملها وتسعى جاهدا الى تحسين وضعها المادي والاجتماعي لها حب كبير في عملها فهي دائمة التطور والتجديد تتميز بحب الناس لها في العمل ولها زبائن من ميحطها وجيرانها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شرلاء ثياب موسمية + بيجامات
texts.en: Rajae is 37 years old and unmarried. She has been selling children's clothes and pajamas for 10 years. She loves her business and aspires to improve her financiA. and sociA. situation. She is passionate about what she does and is constantly seeking ways to improve and develop. Her customers range are her neighbours and the locA. community and they all love her. With this loan she wants to purchase up to date and seasonA. stock.

loans.use: to purchase in-season clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa por mayor y menor en el interior del país, el crédito lo requiere para adquirir mas ropa deportiva por  que tiene demanda. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  La cliente se encuentra muy feliz por que con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus ingresos mejoraron mucho.
texts.en: Mrs. Juana sells clothes wholesale and retail in her country. The loan will be used to acquire more athletic wear to meet her client's demand. She lives in her home located in the Pasankeri area south of the city of La Paz. She is single and has two children.  She is very satisfied with prior loans she was offered to buy more clothes resulting in an increase of profits.

loans.use: To buy more athletic wear to meet her client's demand.

loans.name: Mek

texts.en:
Mek S. is married and resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. and her husband are farmers and raise fish, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell.

loans.name: Elephant Group

texts.en:
J. M., who is in his early twenties, is married. He has been running chicken, fruit and vegetable businesses for one year.  He works from 10:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be J.'s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to start the fruit and vegetable business and has paid back his loan successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more chicks for his chicken business. His dream is to one day build his own house.

J. will share this loan with his loan group "Elephant", which has a total of 21 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture J. is in the back, holding a baby.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a taxi in order to improve the household income

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau K. is 31 years old, married and has three children. He lives in Narok, Kenya. He has been in farming for the last four years and earns a good income. 
 
He learned about KADET Ltd. through other clients registered in his area. This will be his second loan from KADET and he intends to spend the entire loan amount to prepare his land for next planting season.

The anticipated profit generated is to be plowed back into the business. He dreams of practicing large-scale farming. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for the next planting season

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. Gertrude has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. She also sells fruit and water and rents out houses as an additional source of income. Gertrude has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more fish to sell. She generates additional income through selling passion juice water from her refrigerator and from her rental rooms.

The main business challenge for Gertrude is seasonality. Her goal is to improve the quality of life for herself and her children and to see more profits. Gertrude lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Neemat

texts.ar: نعمات في عمر 46 سنة تعمل في التجميل النسائي لها في عملها 33 سنة تحب عملها وتجيده كثيرا هي متطورة نشيطة ومحبة للعمل متزوجة ولها اربع اولاد تريد لهم العيش الجيد والكريم تسعى الى زيادة مدخول عائلتها وتطويره تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى مساعدة ابنتها على دفع تكاليف الزواج ومساعدتها فهي متكفلة في دفع مصاريف اولادها واعالتهم
texts.en: Neemat is 46 years old and married with four children. She works in a beauty salon and has been doing so for 33 years. She is skillful and enthusiastic about her work. She also likes to keep up to date with hair styles and loves her job. She aspires to increase her income and thereby secure a comfortable standard of living for her family. With this loan she wants to help pay for her daughter's wedding as she is responsible for her children's wedding expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban es periodista y su esposa es comerciante, el crédito lo requiere para el pago de mensualidades ya que el señor estudia en una universidad privada, es casado tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva y se encuentra muy satisfecho con las condiciones de los créditos.
texts.en: Esteban is a reporter and his wife is a merchant. He requires a loan to pay his monthly tuition fees. He is attending a private university. He is married and he has two children. He lives in a house which he owns in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. This is the second time he requests a loan through Kiva and he is very happy with the loan conditions.

loans.use: to pay his monthly tuition fees for his university studies in journalism

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité pertenece al barrio Villa Bonita de la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Unidas con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos hoy en día trabajan juntas para salir adelante.
Cada una de ellas dispone de sus propios microemprendimientos comerciales, tienen buena organización, sin embargo les es difícil realizar actividades grupales por los horarios, pues no coinciden, pero en la última reunión se comprometieron a realizarlas, ya que es un requisito de la Fundación dicha actividad.
Todos sus ahorros están depositados en una cooperativa, todas colaboran cuando una persona no está pudiendo pagar por algún inconveniente familiar.
Además se muestran muy agradecidas con nuestra empresa por la oportunidad brindada, ya que les sirve para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
La sra. Adelaida, quien es presidenta del comité, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colonias, mediante este negocio ella se mantiene a si misma y a su familia, pero desea aumentar los ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida por ello solicita el crédito, para poder comprar en mayores cantidades los perfumes y a precios más económicos a modo de dejar un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
This committee is from Villa Bonita neighborhood, in the town of Villa Elisa.  Its members are united in their aim to increase their income.  They work together to get ahead.  Each one of the women has her own small business undertaking and their group is well organized.  However, it is difficult for them to carry out group activities because of their working hours which do not coincide.  During their last meeting, the women pledged to carry out some group activities since this is a requirement that Fundación Paraguaya imposes.  All the group's savings are deposited in a joint account.  They all work together when a member isn't able to pay due to family problems.  The members of this group are very grateful to our company for the opportunity we have offered them since it will help them to improve their income.

Adelaida is the president of this committee.  Her business is selling perfumes and cologne.  Through her business she supports herself and her family but she would like to increase her income so that she can improve her quality of life.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy her perfumes in larger quantities and for less money.  This will enable her to enjoy a larger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cologne

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks.

loans.name: Memusi  Ole

texts.en:
Memusi Ole K., aged 37 years, is married to Esther K., who is a housewife. They have  five children. 

He has been farming in Narok town for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000 

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client. He has applied for a second loan of KES 40,000 to buy farm supplies and do land preparation. He intends to reinvest the anticipated profit from the loan into the business and pay school fees.

He is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare the land

loans.name: Rita

texts.ar: ريتا في عمر 35 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع فساتين الأعراس والسهرات لها في عملها 5 سنوات تحب عملها وتجيده كثيرا لها تاريخ جيد في العمل ولها زبائن كثر من محيطها جيرانها وهي تتميز بالتجدد والتطور تحب عملها وتريد دائما التحسين والتقدم فهي طموحة محبة للعمل والنشاط تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فساتين جديدة للموسم الصيفي حتى تتمكن من مواكبة المواسم حيث انها تعتمد على الموسم الصيفي في الاعراس والحفلات
texts.en: Rita is 35 years old and unmarried. She works selling wedding and evening dressing. She has been doing this for five years, is skillful and loves her work. Her business has a good history and she has many local customers. She is always seeking improvement and progress and she is very ambitious. She loves being active and loves her business. With this loan she wants to purchase new summer clothing stock in order to keep up to date with the season. She depends on getting more customers in summer due to weddings and parties.

loans.use: to buy new summer clothing stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Sospeter K., who is in his early thirties, is single. He has been a photographer for two years.  He works from 8:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sospeter's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes for a loan to buy a printer. His dream is to one day make his business big and famous.

Sospeter will share this loan with his loan group, "Topi", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Sospeter is 1st on the left in a blue shirt and holding a book.  Another group member, Max N., was unfortunately behind a big leaf, so a part of his face is not seen.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca L. cuenta con 49 años D. edad, es madre D. dos hijas, una D. ellas D. cinco años D. edad y la otra con 31 años.
Francisca se dedica al comercio dirigiendo su despensa, donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos, tales como arroz, pastas, carne, productos lácteos y otros. Además D. dicha actividad, Francisca se dedica a la preparación D. comidas rápidas con la ayuda D. su hija mayor.
Francisca agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad D. seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
Ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra D. comestibles, frutas, verduras, carnes, bebidas, artículos D. limpieza, D. aseo personal, etc.
texts.en:
Francisca L. is 49 years old.  She has two daughters aged 5 and 31.

Francisca owns a small grocery store.  She sells all types of goods such as rice, pasta, meat, dairy products, etc.  In addition to this business, Francisca also prepares fast food with the help of her eldest daughter.

Francisca is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are giving her to continue growing in her business.  She would like to invest her loan in buying food products, fruit, vegetables, meat, drinks, cleaning products, personal care products, etc.

loans.use: to buy cereals, fruit, vegetables, meat, drinks, cleaning products, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Kipolonto Ole

texts.en:
Kipolonto Ole M. has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 40 years old, married to two wives who both are housewives and blessed with 12 children.

He learned about KADET Ltd. from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his second loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

Kipolontos’ dream is to be the best and best-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Rodina

texts.ar: ردوينه في عمر 36 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان تعمل في بيع الألعاب والخطوط التعبئة للهواتف النقالة لها في عملها 11 سنة تريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لها ولعائلتها التي هي كل اهتمامها تريد دائما التجدد والتطور تحب العمل تعاني من منافسة في محيطها العملي وما ينقصها هي المادة لدعم عملها وتحسينه تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء العاب جديدة + خطوط تشريج للهواتف النقالة لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكانت تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها
texts.en: Rodina is 32 years old and married with two sons. She works in the business of selling toys and mobile phone lines. She has been doing this for 11 years. She would like to secure a good future for herself and her family, who are her priority. She is always seeking ways to develop her work, and loves what she does. She is exposed to a lot of competition in her local area and she suffers from lack of financial support to improve her business. With this loan she hopes to purchase new toys and mobile phone lines to sell. She has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua. She has the full support of her family and has many customers from her neighbours and local area.

loans.use: to purchase new toys and mobile phone lines to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a twenty-five-year-old married woman with two children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for two years. She started by picking cotton and saved money to start her shop. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is to become a wholesale trader. Betty intends to use the loan to buy sugar, millet flour and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, millet flour and salt for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has one child. She also takes care of additional family members.

Hellen has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hellen lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food. She also raises chickens as an additional source of income. 

Helen has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of  charcoal. The main business challenge for Hellen is operational costs and the rainy season. Her goal is to expand her business and improve the quality of life for herself and her child.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Phebis

texts.en: Phebis is a thirty-year-old married woman with three children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in textiles for two years starting with a capital of 600,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is high rent and her vision is own a boutique and educate her children. Phebis needs the loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Azbayar

texts.en:
Azbayar is 32 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone else's backyard. Her husband helps her with the business. 

She began operating her own business in 2005. She imports leather gloves and glasses from China and sells them at her rented stall at the market. She pays 60,000 MNT for rent on the stall. Her average daily income is 40,000 to 60,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "We want to increase our profit and build a house where we can have a comfortable life."  She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more leather gloves and other consumer goods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more leather gloves for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema M. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Rehema has a business selling plantains. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works two days out of every week. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. The main business challenge for Rehema is transportation. Rehema lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Houda

texts.ar: هدى متزوجة ولها 1 هي في عمر 32 سنة تعمل في صناعة المونة الموسمية لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عملها تعمل بكد ونشاط تتميز بالعمل الدقيق والنظيف تريد ان تتطور وان تزيد من مدخولها السنوي فعملها يعتمد على المواسم تحب اولادها وتتمنى دائما التطور لهم تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضاعة لديها من خلال شراء الزيت والعلب المضغوطة والجوز وغيره هي نشيطة وتحب التجدد والتقدم في العمل
texts.en: Housa is 32 years old and married with one child. She works in the preparation of seasonal vine leaves (used to make various delicacies) and has 10 years experience in this. She loves her work and is enthusiastic about what she does. She is distinguished with attention to detail and cleanliness. She wants to develop and increase her annual income as her work is seasonal. She loves her family and is always seeking progress for them. With this loan she wants to purchase ingredients and supplies, such as oil, nuts and airtight containers. She loves new ideas and progress in her work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies, such as oil, nuts and airtight containers.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a forty-three-year-old married man with six children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running his shop for six years. He started by selling firewood then set up a retail shop. His hardships are debtors and high rent and his vision is a wholesale business and  buying a motorcycle. Ernest wants the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 42-year-old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the produce business for ten years. He started it with 500,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings. 

His hardship is price fluctuation and his vision is buying a processing machine and having a well educated family.

With the loan, Benard intends to renovate the food store.

loans.use: to rennovate the food store

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la unión D. varias señoras vecinas del asentamiento Villa del Sur  y María Auxiliadora del barrio Mbokajaty D. la ciudad D. Villa Elisa.
Este comité es excelente, salen adelante gracias a la inversión del crédito en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
La Sra. Marta Cristina
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to several neighbors from Villa del Sur y María Auxiliadora settlement, in Mbokajaty neighborhood, in the town of Villa Elisa.

This is an excellent committee whose members get ahead in life as they invest their loans in their respective commercial activities.

Marta Cristina

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 37-year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in a retail shop for four years. He started it with capital of 200,000 shillings and increased to 3,000,000 shillings. 

His hardship is bad debtors and  his vision is a wholesale business and and buying a motorcycle.

Alex needs the loan facility to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag B., 51, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Her husband is self-employed. Her eldest son is in the army and her second son works for a transportation company, while her youngest, a daughter, attends a local secondary school. 

Tungalag began operating her own business in 2000. She makes horsehair ropes and belts, which are used for gers. In the beginning, she sold her products at an outdoor market. Now her business has become more stable and she gets enough custom orders for her products. 

She has recently bought some equipment that increased her production. She is a hardworking person. She says, " I would like to get some more necessary tools so that I can increase my job efficiency."  

She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy a machine for processing horsehair for making ropes and   belts.

loans.use: to buy a machine for processing horsehair

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Maria Josefa L. A.:es de 43 años tiene 4 hijos,ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, ella vende todos los dias para que pueda aumentar su ganacia y asi darle juntamente con su esposo estudio a sus hijos ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas productos comestibles y utiles escolares ya  que donde vive los niños ya empesaron a estudiar y le preguntan si vende cuadernos y aun no tiene para ello solicita el credito su sueño es tener otra tienda mas para poder trabajar y asi poder ayudar a su familia economicamente.
texts.en: Maria Josefa L. Amirales is 43 years old. She sells basic food items. She opens for business every day with the goal of increasing her earnings and, together with her husband, provides their children with an education. The kids have gone back to school and her clients request notebooks but she doesn't have them in stock, which is the reason for the loan. Her dream is to have another store and to be able to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and school supplies

loans.name: Hindra Jesus

texts.es: Cliente tiene 25 años es estudiante y trabaja en la Moto que la compro junto con su primo vive en la casa de sus padres junto con sus hermanos es un muchacho emprendedor y con ganas de superacion es soltero no tiene carga familiar.El credito lo solicita para capital de trabajo invertir en la compra y cambio de puertas para poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus padres y terminar de estudiar para tener su propio negocio y salir adelante ya que es una persona joven.
texts.en: He is 25 years old and works and he works with a motorcycle rickshaw which was purchased together with his cousin. He lives with his parents in their house together with his siblings. He is an enterprising young man who is eager for self-improvement.  He doesn't have a family of his own. He requests the loan to use as working capital and to invest in the purchase of new doors. He will continue to keep working and helping his parents. He will also finish his studies to have a business of his own in order to support himself.

loans.use: to purchase new doors for his rickshaw

loans.name: Gotov

texts.en:
Gotov C., 52, is married and lives with his wife and a son in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife is self-employed and his daughter attends a local secondary school. 

His wife helps him with the business. He began selling consumer goods in 2002. He started his business with the working capital of 1,200,000 MNT. Then he got a loan of 600,000 MNT from XacBank in 2004 and now his working capital exceeds 8,000,000 MNT in addition to his inventory and his container at the local market. 

He imports his consumer goods from Beijing and goes to China once or twice a month. Gotov is a hardworking and active person who says, " We want to save some money in order to help our youngest son start his life." 

He is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Basila

texts.ar: باسيلا سيدة تبلغ من العمر 56 عاماً، متزوجة ولها 4 اولاد. تعمل في بيع الالعاب والهدايا لها 5  سنوات في عملها وهي سعيدة به كثيراً،أعز شيء على قلب باسيلا هي عائلتها فهي كل اهتمامها تسعى  دائما الى مساعدة أفرادهاعلى تطوير أنفسهم. تحب العمل ولها زبائن من محيطها ما يميزها هو الانفراد في هذا العمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل العاب وكراسي بلاستكية للأطفال لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث انها تتلقى الدعم من العائلة والمحيط العملي
texts.en: Basila is 56 years old and married with four children. She works selling toys and gifts and has 5 years experience in this. She loves her family and they are her sole priority. She always wants to help her family by seeking progress for herself. She loves her work and has customers from her local area. What distinguishes her is the uniqueness of her business and with this loan she wants to purchase new stock, such as toys and plastic chairs for children. She has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua  and has the support of her family and local residents.

loans.use: to purchase new stock, such has new toys and plastic chairs for children

loans.name: Namsraijav

texts.en:
Namsraijav D., 52, is married and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. 

Her husband is unemployed and her son has a health problem because of a car accident. They used to live in an apartment and sold it to help their son go to work in Korea. Their son had a car accident when he came back from Korea. 

Namsraijav began selling women's lingerie in 2003 and operated two stalls that she owned. Then she had to sell one of her two stalls when her son had the accident. 

Now her son is getting much better after a long treatment and she wants to operate her business properly. Her current stall is located at a crowded market. Her daily gross income is 80,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. She goes to China once or twice a month depending on the sales. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more items to sell in her business, and also to repair her ger.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en: Neverless is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in retail for 18 years. Her hardships are debtors, price fluctuations, and high transport costs; her dreams are to become a wholesale businesswoman and educate her family. Neverless is requesting a loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Lham-Erdene

texts.en: Lham-Erdene S. is 33 years old,  married, and has two children.  They live in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living. Her husband works as a fireman for a company in the winter. They used to live in the countryside and came to live in the city in 2002. Lham-Erdene began her clothing trading business in 2005 by renting a stall at the local market. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital in order to have her own store in the future. They bought a car with their profits last year and her husband drives it as a taxi in order to earn additional income. She is a hardworking and patient person who says, " We would like to have an apartment in the future."  Lham-Erdene is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more clothing from China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo T. R. está casado con Maria Colina de profesión modista, quien también es cliente recurrente de la  Fundación Paraguaya.
El es carpintero y actualmente posee dos operaciones activas.
El cliente tiene una carpintería en su casa propia, ubicada en San Isidro de la ciudad de Encarnación, con más de 10 años de antigüedad en su profesión.
El comenta que gracias a los créditos recibidos de la institución ha podido ir creciendo en su actividad comprando materiales, y gracias a esta actividad el puede solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.
Por ello solicita nuevamente otro préstamo de Kiva, con el que pueda comprar una cierra eléctrica para poder agilizar sus trabajos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alfredo T. R. is married to Maria Colina who is a dressmaker.  She is also a long-standing client of Fundación Paraguaya.

Alfredo is a carpenter and he currently has two active operations.  He has a carpenter's workshop which is located in his own home, in San Isidro, in the town of Encarnación.  He has been in this trade for more than 10 years.

Alfredo tells us that, thanks to the loans he has received from the institution, he has been able to grow in his business, buying materials and, thanks to his business, he can cover any unforeseen expense that could present itself.

Alfredo is requesting a new Kiva loan which he will use to buy an electric saw to make his jobs run more smoothly and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop for five years. His hardship is increased rent; his vision is to complete his house. Samuel is requesting a loan to buy salt and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase salt and rice to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and lives with his spouse who is a business woman and one other dependent. He lives in a rented home and his family goal is to work hard and become self sustained. Peter has a textile business, which he has operated for four years. He started it from his salary savings and faces a challenge of seasonal demand fluctuations. He hopes  to have a wholesale business. Peter is requesting a loan to purchase textiles.

loans.use: To purchase textiles

loans.name: Sundui

texts.en:
Sundui T., 24, is married and lives with his wife and a 1-year-old son in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

His wife is unemployed and looks after their baby. Sundui began operating a computer repair service in 2005 and opened an Internet center in 2010 in addition to his previous business. He holds a degree in IT engineering and it has been an advantage for him to run his business successfully. 

Now he repairs computers, runs his Internet center and has recently opened a photography studio for his business. He is a hardworking person who says, "My wife has not finished her university yet and I am taking care of my family by my business profits." 

He is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase more gear for his photography studio.

loans.use: to purchase more gear for his studio

loans.name: Serge

texts.fr:
Serge est vendeur des pains depuis 5ans, il est marié père de 2 enfants 1 à 5ans.
Sa gentillesse, le soin dans la présentation de ses produits sont sa stratégie de vente, il attire plus de clients en faisant des sandwiches à bon prix.
Ses ventes par jour varient entre15000F et 35000F.
Le prêt passé lui a permis d’ajouter en  plus des ventes des pains un coin cabine téléphonique et ventes des cartes prépayées.
Avec le prêt du deuxième cycle, il va continuer à satisfaire ses clients et il va acheter : 1 demi carton du beurre pasteurisé, 10 boites de pâté, 5boites de la margarine, 1carton du fromage 1grosse boite du chocolats à tartiner, 10 tiges  de saucisson à l’ail, 10 tiges de saucisson sec, il va aussi acheter les cartes téléphoniques de chaque réseaux locales.
Dans le but d’exceller dans ce commerce afin d’ouvrir une boutique alimentaire, monsieur serge a de la volonté pour exercer cet activité car il s’occupe de sa petite famille grâce à cela. Très docile et accueillant les habitant de son quartier préfère acheter chez lui.
texts.en:
Serge has been selling bread for 5 years.  He is married and father of 2 children between the ages of 1 and 5.  Kindness and care in the presentation of his products are his sales strategy.  He attracts more customers by making sandwiches for a good price.

His daily sales vary between 15,000 F and 35,000 F.

His past loan allowed him to add a telephone booth and the sale of prepaid calling cards to his business of selling bread.

With this second loan, he will continue to satisfy his customers. He will buy 1 half-carton of pasteurized butter, 10 boxes of dough, 5 boxes of margarine, 1 carton of cheese, 1 large box of chocolate spread, 10 links of garlic sausage, 10 links of dried sausage.  He will also buy phone cards from each local network provider.

With the goal of excelling in this trade in order to open a food store, Mr. Serge has the desire to be in this business because he provides for his family thanks to it.  Very docile and friendly, the residents of his area prefer to buy at his store.

loans.use: to buy wholesale pasteurized butter, dough, margarine, sausage links, chocolate spread, prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar L., 33, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past seven years. 

His wife makes clothes at home and his older son attends a local secondary school, while his younger son goes to a kindergarten. 

Ulambayar began making wooden products in 2000. In the beginning, he used to make wooden products at home, and now he has set up an extra ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and operates his business in there. He has been operating his business for more than a decade and has become an experienced carpenter who has many regular customers. 

He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. He is a hardworking person who takes initiative. He says, "My future wish is to expand my business and increase my profits." 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and necessary materials.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Gerelt

texts.en:
Gerelt T., 53, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. 

Her husband is a driver and they operate a transportation business together. They transport people from one place to another in the city by their micro-bus. They began this business in 2006 and they support their living by the profit of their transportation business. Their daily family income is 50,000 MNT and she says, "We are trying to save money because one of our children has a serious health problem and needs have an operation abroad." 

Gerelt is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy a spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their micro-bus.

loans.use: to buy a spare parts for their micro-bus

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Miguel se denomina "Las Mercedes", surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 9º ciclo ahora, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2008.
La presidenta del comité es la Sra. Tomasa B., es soltera y tiene 7 hijos, todos independientes, ella trabaja en su domicilio desde hace varios años, tiene una despensa muy bien surtida.
La Sra. Tomasa desea invertir el crédito de la fundación en la compra de mercaderías en cantidad (al por mayor), para volver a surtir su despensa lo que la ayudaría a ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes y mayor variedad de productos.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida ya que gracias a Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group from San Miguel neighborhood is called 'Las Mercedes'.  The group was formed as a result of promotional activities that Fundación Paraguaya carried out in the local area.  The group is now in its ninth loan cycle and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2008.

The president of this committee is Tomasa B. who is single and has 7 children who all live independently.  She has a very well-stocked grocery store in her home and has been working there for several years.  Tomasa would like to invest her loan in buying merchandise in bulk (wholesale) so that she can re-stock her store.  This will help her to offer her customers better prices and a better variety of products.

Tomasa is very grateful since, thanks to Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya, she is able to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy food products, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Maman Thérèse est âgée de 50 ans, mariée mère de 2enfants dont l’âge varie entre 30 et 35ans. Elle a commencée son restaurant en 2000 avec un capital de 15000F.
Son restaurant est situé à  l’angle de sa ruelle ou elle vend le matin avec la cafétéria et a partir de 11heures 30 le restaurant avec ses plats variés.
Ses recettes journalières sont  entre 45000F et 50000F.
L’expérience du prêt précédent lui a permis d’épargner et de comprendre son activité. Pour cela elle à améliorer les conditions de son coin restaurant en ajoutant un coté ou l’on mange sur place.
Avec le prêt 2 du cycle 2, elle va continuer à renforcer son stock de marchandise en achetant :
1sac de riz, 1panier de poisson fumé, 10kilos de viande de bœuf, 1bidon d’huile  végétale, 1 filet d’oignons, 1 carton de poisson salé morue, de la pâté d’arachide, de haricot, 1carton de tomates en boites.
 
Ses 2 enfants sont grande et indépendante car ils travaillent déjà, elle s’occupe et assiste scolairement les 2autres enfants qui sont à sa charge.
Elle pense que son activité prospère chaque jour et veux plus épargner pour acheter la parcelle de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mother Thérèse is a 50 year old married mother of two; her children are between 30 and 35. She started up her restaurant in 2000 with starting capital of 15,000 F. Her restaurant is on the corner of her street, and in the morning is a sort of cafeteria, then after 11:30 becomes a restaurant with various dishes. Her daily income is between 45,000 F and 50,000 F. 
Her previous loan allowed her to put some money aside for savings and to bolster her business. She improved her restaurant's facilities by adding a seating area inside.  With her second loan she aims to purchase: a bag of rice, a basket of smoked fish, 10kg of beef, 1 flask of oil, 1 string of onions, 1 tin of salted cod, peanut butter, beans and a tin of tomatoes. 
Her two children are grown up and independent, with their own jobs, and she pays for the schooling of two other children in her care. She thinks that her business is growing each day, and wishes to put some more money aside to buy a plot of land for her children.

loans.use: to purchase: tins of meat, a basket of smoked fish, a flask of oil, a bag of rice, a string of onions, a tin of salted fish, peanut butter, beans, and tins of tomatoes

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan, 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.  Her husband works as a carpenter and her two younger daughters attend college.  They have a decent standard of living.  

They used to live in the countryside and they came to live in the city when they lost all of their livestock because of a natural disaster in 1999. Then Jargalsaihan began selling wooden products made by her husband by renting a container at a local market in 2004.  She started selling used shoes in 2010 in addition to the wooden products.  Her further wish is to expand her business and increase her working capital in the future. 

She is a hardworking and sociable person who says, " We want to finish our house that is being built at the moment.  I wish to have my own place where I can operate my business in the future so that I can save money on rent".  She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more used shoes and wood materials for her family based business.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Sra. Andrea pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto. Está Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, uno D. los cuales todavía depenD. D. ella.

Motivada desD. muy pequeña por su gusto a la máquina D. coser, los hilos y las agujas, Andrea realizó estudios técnicos en Corte y Confección, con lo que emprendió su negocio D. Costura,  lleva aproximadamente 12 años dedicándose a este rubro, poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida y ahora cuenta con una fiel clientela a quienes atienD. con pedidos; nos cuenta que tiene bastante trabajo por la etapa escolar, también cose vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, pantalones D. vestir y mucho más, su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas al por mayor, D. diferentes especies y colores, tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. máquina, alfileres y botones.

Andrea se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad todos sueños y está agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad D. salir adelante como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Andrea belongs to the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” [Our Lady of Peace] community bank , of the district of Tarapoto. She is married, 56 years old, and has 2 children, one of whom still depends on her.  

She has been motivated by her love of the sewing machine, thread and needles since she was very young. Andrea studied at the Cutting and Tailoring school, and began her sewing business. She has been working in this area for approximately 12 years. Little by little, she became known and now she has faithful clientele whose orders she fills. She tells us that she has a lot of work because of the school year. She also sews suits for women, men and children, dress pants and much more. Her business is located in her own house.   

With this loan of S/. 2500.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy different types and  colors of fabric wholesale, different colored thread in large spools, sewing needles and sewing machine needles, pins and buttons.  

Andrea feels like an accomplished woman, eager to reach her dreams and make them reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving her the chance to get ahead as a woman and business owner.

loans.use: to buy different types and colors of fabrics wholesale, as well as scissors, different colored thread in large spools, sewing needles, pins and buttons.

loans.name: Lhagva

texts.en: Lhagva B. is 28 years old and lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His parents have a few cows and they earn their living from the profits of the milk sales. Lhagva began driving a taxi in 2008 when his father bought him a car. Then he bought a car with his profits. Presently one of his two cars is used by his brother for taxi service. He mostly works in the evening because there is less traffic than in the daytime. His daily gross income is 20,000 to 30,000 MNT. He is planning to save money and buy a land where he can build a house. He is a hardworking and responsible person who says, " I want to save some money and have my own property in the future." He is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase tires and shock absorbers for his car.

loans.use: To purchase tires and shock absorbers

loans.name: Manas

texts.en:
Manas, 26, is married and lives with his wife and a newly born daughter in Hovd province of Mongolia.  His wife is currently unemployed and they have a below average standard of living. Manas began growing vegetables in 2006 and running a taxi service in 2008. 

They currently live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and he is building a house on a small plot of land that he owns. He learned farming from his father who is an experienced farmer in his area.  Manas sells the vegetables that he grows in addition to his taxi service business.  He is a hardworking  and polite person who says, " I am trying to finish my house which is being built now".  He is requesting a loan of 2,950,000 MNT to purchase seeds for his vegetable business and spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Sra. Anita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, del Distrito de Morales yDepartamento de de San Martín, tiene 32 años y 02 hijos que aún dependen de ella.

Desde muy joven se dedica  al Diseño de Modas y costura, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa, en un ambiente amplio y acondicionado. Su responsabilidad, optimismo y gran sentido de deber son sus principales herramientas a la hora de hacer su trabajo, herramientas que le sirvieron para ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, que van desde empresas e instituciones hasta personas particulares. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará: Telas en metros y de diferentes colores, hilos en carretes, blondas, agujas de coser y  para máquina, y parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una remalladora.

Anita manifestó estar muy gradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en el cumplimiento de sus sueños y ayudarla a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the "Las Moralinas” community bank which is located in Morales district, in San Martín department.  She is 32 years old and has 2 children who still depend on her.

Anita has been designing clothes and sewing since she was very young.  Her business is located in her home, in a large space adapted for the purpose.  Her responsibility, optimism and great sense of duty are the main tools that she employs when she carries out her work.  They are tools that have helped her to gain the trust of her customers who include companies, institutions and even private individuals.

Anita will use her loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy different-colored fabric by the meter, reels of thread, lace, needles for sewing by hand and needles for her sewing machine.  She will invest some of her money in buying an overlock sewing machine.

Anita is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to fulfil her dreams and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Monsieur Amévi est marié et a un enfant. Il est âgé de 37 ans. Il est née à vogan et habite quartier Adamavo.  Il est Directeur de l’Institut Technique les Elites qui se trouve derrière le lycée à Baguida. Il dirige cette école depuis 2005. Il demande un prêt pour achater les tables bancs et les outils de tavail pour l’Etablissement.
texts.en: Mr. Amévi is married and has a child.  He is 37 years old.  He was born in Vogan and lives in the Adamavo district.  He is the director of the Technical Institute for Elites, which is located behind the high school in Baguida.  He has directed the school since 2005.  He is asking for a loan to buy bench tables and work tools for the establishment.

loans.use: to purchase bench tables and work tools.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg, 27, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned for several years.  

Her husband helps her with the business and her son attends a local primary school. Odonchimeg began her business by operating a small cafe in 2003 and started selling dairy products in 2008.  She owns the place where she sells dairy products and plans to sell consumer goods in addition to her dairy product trading. 

She wants to expand her business and increase her profit in order to fulfill her goals.  She is a hardworking and initiative taking person who says, "I want to expand my business, increase my profit and fulfill my dreams in the future".  She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en: Tsogzolmaa C. is 47 years old, married, and has three daughters, all of whom attend school.  They live in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband takes care of their livestock in the countryside.  Tsogzolmaa began operating a veterinary medicine practice by getting a license from the government in 2000. She is responsible for the livestock of her area. Her business has become stable as she has gained experience. She takes care of people's livestock and she sells medicine. She wants to expand her business because it is valuable to her community. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, " I would like to expand my business and help people to increase the number of their livestock." She is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to purchase more medicine, useful tools for her veterinary medicine business.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine

loans.name: Telma Maria

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 20,18y 13años de edad respectivamente, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, se dedica a la sastrería tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este oficio. Este es su primer negocio el cual empezó a los 13 años de edad, aprendió costura por medio de un señor que tenia un taller costura, el le enseñaba sin cobrarle nada. Estudio magisterio el cual lo ejerció durante 6 meses en un proyecto de educación para adultos. También vende cosméticos, productos de la Avon lleva 6 meses vendiendo, los distribuye en los diferentes barrios de la ciudad de Estelí, en esta actividad le ayuda a vender u hijo mayor quien vende en las calles de Estelí. A ella le gusta hacer faldas para mujer de la tela que le sobran.
Le gustaría ofertar su producto en los mercados y principales puestos de venta de Estelí. Solicita el crédito para comprar tela y un pedido de cosmético de la Avon. Espera que con este crédito le ayude a crecer su negocio , aumentar su inventario en cuanto la negocio de cosmético y en la sastrería le ayudara a realizar ropa extra para vender. 
Tiene como  planes futuros tener una tienda propia donde pueda vender sus diseños y cosméticos. Como meta próxima desea poder incrementar los pedidos de cosméticos, vender ropa nueva y sobre todo pagarle estudios universitarios a sus hijos por que es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She is a single mother and has 3 children, aged 20, 18 and 13. She is from the departament of Estelí. She has worked as a seamstress for 30 years. This is her first business, which she started when she was 13 years old. She learned sewing through a man who had a workshop. He taught her without charging her anything. She studied teaching, which she did for 6 months in a project for adult education. She also sells Avon product cosmetics. She has been selling these for 6 months. She distributes them in different neighborhoods of the city of Estelí. Her oldest son helps her in this activity, seling in the streets of  Estelí. She likes to make women's skirts with the leftover fabric. 
 
She would like to offer her products in the maekets and main sales points in  Estelí. She is asking for the loan to buy fabric and an order of Avon cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will help her grow her business, increasing her inventory in the cosmetic business and helping her make extra clothes to sell in the seamstress business.  
 
Her plans for the future are to have her own store where she can sell her designs and cosmetics. Her next goal is to increase her cosmetics orders, sell new clothes and above all, pay for her children's college education, which is the best inheritance she can give them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a cosmetics order from Avon.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three sons in Hovd province of Mongolia.  They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own.  Her husband helps her with the business and her two older sons attend college while her youngest son goes to a secondary school. 

Uranchimeg began operating her business in 2002.  In the beginning she used to sell ice-cream and drinks and now she sells many kind of food stuffs. She has been operating her business for nine years and has gained a lot of experience from her business.  She bought furniture for her home with her business revenue. 

She is a hardworking person who says, "I support my family through the profit from my business and pay my children's school fees.  I want to expand my business".  She is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase more food stuffs for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs

loans.name: Kokou Antoine
