texts.en: Dulmaa, 59, is married and lives with her daughter in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. She used to live with her two daughters, but her older daughter got married recently. Her brother grows vegetables at the farm which is 158 km far from the city center. She worked as a janitress at a Medical University for 31 years and began selling vegetables when she retired from her work in 1997. She sells vegetables at a rented stall. She began taking business loans from the bank in 2005. She sells the vegetables purchased from individuals in addition to her brother's crops. She bought a house with land in 2010 with the profit from her business. She is a hardworking and open-minded person who says, " I am trying to save some money to buy a car for my daughter." She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy seeds and purchase potatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and purchase potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 29 years old, while the youngest is only 20.

Nancy is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She plants and harvests rice crops. Nancy prepared her land well and is now ready for planting rice.

Nancy's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes for a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Silvestra is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Silvestra owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, canned goods, junk foods, instant noodles and beverages in the local community. Silvestra has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Silvestra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvestra is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents. This loan will be the first taken out by Silvestra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a piggery. She lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Delia is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can buy feed for her pigs and stock for her general store. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and stock for her general store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 42, is a married mother of five school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya where she has been farming for 15 years. She employs one farmhand and sells her milk to the local market.

Angelina has requested for this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start poultry farming. She will use this loan to buy chickens, to build a poultry shed and to buy poultry feeds. The extra income from this project will help her pay school fees for her children. She faces the challenge of diseases and lack of a stable market for her products.

loans.use: to start poultry farming

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en: Otgontuya, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a shift driver for a transportation company and gets paid 150,000 to 300,000 MNT monthly. Otgontuya graduated from a vocational school as a shoemaker in 2007 and began working for a workshop with other shoemakers. She has been working there for the last three years and now she makes shoes at home in addition to her job. She is planning to increase her production and make more variety of shoes at home. She is a hardworking person who takes initiative and said, "I would like to increase my profit and save money for my children's future study.".She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more materials for her shoemaking business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for shoemaking

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel M. is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Raquel is widowed and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling junk foods, candies, biscuits and fruit juices in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture are Raquel and her daughter, selling their products.

In 2011, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like breads and rice cakes. This loan will be the first taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like breads and rice cakes

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for six years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Benard is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 9 and 2.

He has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a power saw. The extra income he will earn by hiring the power saw to the local market will help in paying school fees for his children. His main challenges in farming have been diseases and lack of enough animal feeds, which affects his production.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw

loans.name: Gundash

texts.en: Gundash, 26, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. His wife works at a gas station and his older daughter attends a local primary school, while his youngest daughter goes to a kindergarten. Gundash began operating a transportation business in 2008. He transports coal and other goods by his mini-truck. He is trying to increase his profits and improve the living situation of his family. He is a modest and hardworking person who said, "I would like to build a bigger house with heating where we can have a comfortable life." He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Rad

texts.en:
Rad P. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 38 years old. Rad is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rad owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, dried fish, junk foods and food seasonings in the local community. Rad has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages. This loan will be the first taken out by Rad from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 39 years old, is a married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Her husband works in the Philippine Army.

Rowena has a backyard piggery. She fattens the pigs, then sells them to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells chips and other products. She also offers mobile phone credit loads. Rowena works hard to have a stable business.

This loan will be used to purchase feeds and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Junela

texts.en: Junela is a married woman who lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: direct selling (Natasha, Avon, MSE) and buying and selling spare parts for motorcycles. Her husband Tranquilino, who is 40 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living.  They have two children who are 2 and 7 years old. Junela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Junela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase spare parts so that she can continue to save up for the future to improve her business and for her children's education. Junela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Purevdash

texts.en:
Purevdash, 54, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, or Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living.

He began selling consumer goods at a local market in 2007. His wife co-works with him and his daughter sells cosmetics. His business is more family-based and they operate three stalls, two of which are for clothes and one of which is for cosmetic sales.He has expanded his business so far and is increasing his business profits continuously. He is a hardworking person who takes initiative and said, "We are trying hard to expand our business and increase our business revenues to help our children finish their college successfully and we are planning to build a house where we can have a comfortable life in the future." Purevdash is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes and cosmetics from China.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Gerito

texts.en:
Gerito S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 34 years old. Gerito is married. To make a living, Gerito owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Gerito has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gerito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like T-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the first taken out by Gerito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like T-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia T. is from the village of Galingon, Tamilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Virginia is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yosinta

texts.en: Yosinta is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family with the help of her husband, who is a businessman. She has been selling Irish potatoes for the last five years and with the income realized. she has been able to expand her business. She has a challenge of seasonal changes and her greatest desire is to set up a food store that can supply schools around the Rwenzori region. Yosinta needs the loan to buy Irish potatoes.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes

loans.name: Zaya

texts.en: Zaya, 35, is married, and lives with her husband and a son in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver for the local police station and gets paid 200,000 MNT monthly. Her son attends a college. Zaya began retail trading of consumer goods withworking capital of 200,000 MNT in 1991. She has been operating her business continuously and she currently operates two stalls at a local market. She imports clothing from China and she is planning to sell clothing of national factories in the future. She is a hardworking person who takes initiative and said, "I would like to expand my business and increase my profits in order to have my own store in the future." Zaya is requesting a loan of 3,300,000 MNT to purchase more clothing of national factories and import consumer goods from China.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing of national factories

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa E. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 62 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Generosa owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Generosa has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Generosa joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana A. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Susana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, candies, biscuits and fish paste in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Susana joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and junk foods
